long: Meaning: to "be" (causatively, "make") "bitter" (literally or figuratively).  Usage: (be, be in, deal, have, make) bitter(-ly, -ness), be moved with choler, (be, have sorely, it) grieved(-eth), provoke, vex.  Source: a primitive root; properly, to trickle (see "H4752"); but used only as a denominative from "H4751";
